snippet: Of his tying goal with just seconds left in Game 5 of the Rangers-Capitals series, “I was just hacking and whacking,” Brad Richards said.
abstract: New York Rangers center Brad Richards scores game tying goal against Washington Capitals in the frantic final seconds of the third period of Game 5, sending game to overtime. (M)
lead_paragraph: Brad Richards is known for his ability to thread a soft pass and to find the corner of a net with a wrist shot, but there was no artistry in the biggest goal of his first season as a Ranger. ''I was just hacking and whacking,'' Richards said. ''I had no idea how much time was left on the clock.''

headline.main: Persistence, Not Art, Pays Off For Richards
